p: In Poland, according to OECD statistics, the number of pharmacists per 100,000 population is 77, while the average of the OECD countries is 83. In Hungary, Slovakia, Estonia, and Sweden, the number of pharmacists is similar to that in Poland. In many countries, the number of pharmacists per 100,000 inhabitants is lower: the Netherlands—21, Denmark—52, and Germany—65. There are also countries with a much higher number of pharmacists: Belgium—124, Italy—117, and Spain—116 [ 19].
